item.title: Man died after being told not to drive, Coroner says - Independent Community Newspaper
item.description:
Man died after being told not to drive, Coroner says  Independent Community Newspaper

Man's wife hid his car keys and even removed a fuse but Malcolm Gillanders-Ryan insisted on driving.

item.title: 'It could have been prevented': Coroner calls for drinking age to be raised to 20 following death of Blenheim teen - New Zealand Herald
item.description:
'It could have been prevented': Coroner calls for drinking age to be raised to 20 following death of Blenheim teen  New Zealand Herald

A coroner has called for the drinking age to be raised to 20 after a 19-year-old died after drinking a dozen beers and crashing into a truck. Blenheim butcher ...

item.title: Coroner can't get to the bottom of fatal bike crash on Woodville farm - Stuff.co.nz
item.description:
Coroner can't get to the bottom of fatal bike crash on Woodville farm  Stuff.co.nz

Coroner can't get to the bottom of crash that killed a 20-year-old on his parents' farm.

item.title: Coroner's Call To Raise Drinking Age Welcomed - Scoop.co.nz
item.description:
Coroner's Call To Raise Drinking Age Welcomed  Scoop.co.nz

Family First NZ is applauding Coroner David Robinson for his call to raise the drinking age, which echoes previous calls by the NZ Medical Association to raise ...

item.title: Coroner blames alcohol, speed and bad eyesight for Levin road death - New Zealand Herald
item.description:
Coroner blames alcohol, speed and bad eyesight for Levin road death  New Zealand Herald

Alcohol, speed and poor eyesight were likely to be factors in the death of a Levin woman who was killed in a horror smash. Amanda Louise Katherine Sale, 25, ...

item.title: Coroner calls for increase of alcohol purchasing age following death of drink-driving teen - Stuff.co.nz
item.description:
Coroner calls for increase of alcohol purchasing age following death of drink-driving teen  Stuff.co.nz

A coroner is urging the Government to raise the drinking age to 20 after the death of a 19-year-old drink driver. Blenheim butcher George Bernard Holland was ...

item.title: Coroner links synthetic cannabis to two more deaths - Stuff.co.nz
item.description:
Coroner links synthetic cannabis to two more deaths  Stuff.co.nz

His friends didn't wake him from his 'synthetic nap' for fear he'd be angry. Instead he died.

item.title: Police and coroner meet Pike River families after re-entry plan approved - Stuff.co.nz
item.description:
Police and coroner meet Pike River families after re-entry plan approved  Stuff.co.nz

The chief coroner has indicated the inquest into the Pike River mine disaster could be reopened after authorities re-enter the mine's drift. Chief Coroner Judge ...

item.title: Death in prison of man with Asperger's 'raises serious concerns' - The Guardian
item.description:
Death in prison of man with Asperger's 'raises serious concerns'  The Guardian

A coroner has expressed concern over the care given in prison to a man serving a sentence for a botched terrorism attack who was found hanged in his cell. Mohammed Saeed Alim, who was born Nicky Reilly, was jailed in 2009 after a bungled attempt to set off a homemade bomb in a Devon restaurant. Saeed Alim, 30, a Muslim convert, was discovered dead at HMP Manchester in October 2016. Following a two-week hearing, a jury concluded it was “more likely than not” that he did not intend to end his life and “acted impulsively” as a result of Asperger syndrome and an emotionally unstable personality...

item.title: Darwin teenager's suicide a 'heart-wrenching' story of missed opportunity, coroner finds - ABC News
item.description:
Darwin teenager's suicide a 'heart-wrenching' story of missed opportunity, coroner finds  ABC News

By Felicity James The suicide of a Darwin teenager is a "heart-wrenching" story of missed opportunities and failures by GPs and other medical professionals, a coroner has found. Sabrina Di Lembo, 19, took her own life in August 2017 after experiencing serious anxiety and panic attacks in the lead-up to university assessments and exams. In the last nine weeks of Sabrina's life, she had contact with Northern Territory health professionals on 17 separate occasions — and her mother Lidia had more than 20 interactions. "The care and treatment of Sabrina was a heart-wrenching story of missed oppo...

item.title: 'It's as if it never happened': Widow 'left in the dark' after her husband's death - ABC News
item.description:
'It's as if it never happened': Widow 'left in the dark' after her husband's death  ABC News

It's been more than a year since the death of her husband in a workplace accident, but Terry Delaney says she's still being left in the dark by authorities. Key points: - Terry Delaney says she's heard little from her husband's employers since his passing - Carl Delaney's death has prompted renewed calls for industrial manslaughter laws - NT Attorney-General Natasha Fyles says the Government will consider its own legislation Carl Delaney was working for a subcontractor on the INPEX Itchthys LNG Project when he was killed on the night of Wednesday, 29 November 2017. His death led the Electri...

item.title: BBC radio presenter found dead after walking out mid-way through radio show, inquest hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
BBC radio presenter found dead after walking out mid-way through radio show, inquest hears  The Telegraph

A BBC radio presenter found dead at her home hours after leaving work mid-way through her radio show intended to take her own life, a coroner has ruled. Shropshire Coroner's Court was told that Vicki Archer, who left work during a drivetime show, had a history of depression and had made two previous attempts on her life. The 41-year-old, who had emailed a colleague at BBC Radio Shropshire saying she was feeling upset, was found hanged in her house in Woodcote Way, Shrewsbury, on August 6 this year. Coroner John Ellery was told the divorced mother-of-three, who left work at about 5pm, was fo...

item.title: Toddler died after doctor failed to treat sepsis infection, coroner finds - ABC News
item.description:
Toddler died after doctor failed to treat sepsis infection, coroner finds  ABC News

By Jessica Clifford A NSW coroner has found that a 17-month-old toddler died due to the failure of doctors to recognise, investigate and treat a bacterial infection. Troy Almond died less than 24 hours after being discharged from Nowra's Shoalhaven Hospital on March 22, 2016. Troy's mother took him to the emergency department the day before he died, however the coroner found the hospital failed to follow the policies in place for people presenting with symptoms of a bacterial infection. During the inquest, the doctor who treated the toddler apologised to the family and told them he had made...

item.title: Grand Canyon helicopter crash 'could have been prevented' - The Guardian
item.description:
Grand Canyon helicopter crash 'could have been prevented'  The Guardian

A helicopter crash in the Grand Canyon that killed five British tourists in February could have been prevented, an inquest has heard. James Healy-Pratt, representing the parents of a group of friends who died after the Airbus helicopter plummeted to the ground and caught fire, made the claim at West Sussex coroner’s court during a pre-inquest review on Tuesday. Rebecca Dobson, 26, her boyfriend, Stuart Hill, 29, and his brother, Jason Hill, 31, died in the crash shortly before sunset on 10 February. Their friends Jonathan Udall, 31, of Southampton, and 29-year-old Eleanor Milward, who were ...

item.title: Inquest to examine whether SA Police could have prevented woman's death - ABC News
item.description:
Inquest to examine whether SA Police could have prevented woman's death  ABC News

By Claire Campbell An inquest into the death of a woman in Oodnadatta will examine whether South Australian police could have arrested her partner — who was wanted in another state — before he killed her. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that the following story contains the names of people who have died. Serina May Amos, 34, died from blunt force trauma and contributing ischaemic heart disease in the Outback town on July 3, 2015. The coronial inquest heard she was driven to the Oodnadatta health clinic by her partner Danny Ferguson, her sister and brother-in-law an...

item.title: Bridesmaid died after falling and hitting her head on the way to her brother's wedding, inquest hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
Bridesmaid died after falling and hitting her head on the way to her brother's wedding, inquest hears  The Telegraph

A bridesmaid died after falling and hitting her head on the way to her brother's wedding, an inquest has heard. Sammie Bowman, 22, was helping the bridal party with last minute arrangements when she fell over backwards onto concrete. Miss Bowman was rushed to hospital, where doctors operated in an attempt to save her life. However, she died two days later from the devastating brain injury. The inquest at Hull Coroner's Court heard the wedding party had gathered at a rented cottage near Pocklington, East Riding of Yorkshire, for the wedding of her brother Andrew on May 31. The bridal party h...

item.title: Carl Sargeant lacked pastoral care after sacking, inquest hears - The Guardian
item.description:
Carl Sargeant lacked pastoral care after sacking, inquest hears  The Guardian

A Welsh government minister has told an inquest she did not believe enough pastoral care was given to Carl Sargeant after he was sacked as a cabinet secretary. Lesley Griffiths, the cabinet secretary for energy, planning and rural affairs, also said she thought there should be a formal support network in place for sacked ministers. Sargeant, 49, was found hanged four days after he was dismissed as cabinet secretary for communities and children by the Welsh first minister, Carwyn Jones, after three women alleged inappropriate sexual behaviour against him. The father-of-two was found by his w...

item.title: Immigration detainee killed himself after self-harming, inquest hears - The Guardian
item.description:
Immigration detainee killed himself after self-harming, inquest hears  The Guardian

A Slovenian waiter killed himself while being held in an immigration detention centre, an inquest jury has found. Branko Zdravkovic, 43, had self-harmed while in detention and had problems with alcohol, Bournemouth coroner’s court was told. The jury returned a verdict of suicide. Although detention centre staff recognised his vulnerability and put him on self-harm watch, no report was sent to the Home Office flagging up suicidal intentions, as required under guidance known as rule 35 (2) . The assistant coroner, Stephen Nicholls, gave the Home Office 14 days to provide further evidence rela...

item.title: 'I wish they'd kept me, I'm hurting': Hospital 'not to blame' for 82yo's death - ABC News
item.description:
'I wish they'd kept me, I'm hurting': Hospital 'not to blame' for 82yo's death  ABC News

By Manika Dadson The daughter of an 84-year-old woman who died seven days after a bad fall said she had to watch her mother wait in agony for an ambulance and that she should have been kept at hospital instead of being sent home. And while a coroner's report found it would have been "more appropriate" and in accord with the woman's "needs" for her to remain in hospital, the likelihood of death was "real, irrespective of the level of care provided" by the hospital. Gweneth Elsie Lillian Jones was placing a book back on a shelf in her Devonport nursing home room in November 2016 when she lost...

item.title: Allegations against Carl Sargeant 'could not be ignored', inquest hears - The Guardian
item.description:
Allegations against Carl Sargeant 'could not be ignored', inquest hears  The Guardian

The Welsh first minister has told the inquest into the death of a colleague who was found hanged four days after he was sacked from his cabinet post that allegations of inappropriate sexual behaviour made against him could not be ignored. Carwyn Jones said that he had decided to make one last reshuffle before leaving office to bring into government people he believed could replace him. But allegations about Carl Sargeant’s behaviour towards women surfaced. The first minister said: “During the course of discussions about having a general reshuffle, the allegations came forward regarding Carl...

item.title: Labour politician told family he was 'taking easy way out' after MeToo suspension, inquest into his death hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
Labour politician told family he was 'taking easy way out' after MeToo suspension, inquest into his death hears  The Telegraph

A Welsh politician accused of sexual misconduct left a note for his family apologising for "taking the easy way out" and "letting them down", his inquest has heard. Welsh Assembly member Carl Sargeant, 49, was found hanged by his wife Bernadette at the family home in Connah's Quay, North Wales. His death, on November 7, 2017, came four days after being sacked from his role as cabinet secretary for communities and children. The father-of-two was also suspended from the Labour Party over allegations of "unwanted attention, inappropriate touching or groping", seen at the time as the latest wav...

item.title: Welsh first minister 'furious' when Carl Sargeant went public over sacking - The Guardian
item.description:
Welsh first minister 'furious' when Carl Sargeant went public over sacking  The Guardian

The Welsh first minister was “furious” when a senior politician he had sacked amid allegations of sexual misconduct went public about his dismissal, an inquest heard. Carl Sargeant was found hanged at his family home in north Wales four days after he was sacked as a cabinet secretary by first minister Carwyn Jones. It has been claimed during Sargeant’s inquest that Jones “fuelled the despair” of his colleague and friend by giving television interviews about his case the day before he died. On the second day of the inquest, a written statement was read out from Steve Jones, a former special ...

item.title: Carl Sargeant inquest hears he was found dead days after sacking - The Guardian
item.description:
Carl Sargeant inquest hears he was found dead days after sacking  The Guardian

The wife of the Welsh politician Carl Sargeant found him dead in the utility room of their home four days after he was sacked as a government minister, an inquest has heard. Sargeant, 49, who had been accused of sexual misconduct, was discovered by his wife, Bernie, at the family’s home in Connah’s Quay, north Wales, last year. The north Wales coroner John Gittins said a suicide note was found, and he told the inquest the cause of death was hanging. Traces of antidepressant were found in samples taken from Sargeant’s body. On the first day of the inquest, which is due to last five days, Git...

item.title: Prime suspect in teen killing offers to take lie-detector test at inquest - ABC News
item.description:
Prime suspect in teen killing offers to take lie-detector test at inquest  ABC News

By Ellie Sibson A convicted murderer and prime suspect in the cold-case murder of Toowoomba teenager Annette Mason has told a coronial inquest into her death that he is willing to take a lie-detector test on the matter. The 15-year-old was found bludgeoned to death in her house in November 1989 after a night out with friends. A previous inquest found there wasn't enough evidence to find anyone responsible for her death. Allan McQueen, described by police officers and counsel assisting the coroner Adrian Braithwaite as a prime suspect in the police investigation, was sentenced to life in pri...

item.title: Colombian coroner says Odebrecht whistleblower died of heart attack - Reuters
item.description:
Colombian coroner says Odebrecht whistleblower died of heart attack  Reuters

A Colombian investigation into the death of Jorge Enrique Pizano, a key witness at the center of a corruption probe involving Brazilian construction firm Odebrecht [ODBES.UL], found that he died of a heart attack, the chief coroner said on Friday. The attorney general's office on Tuesday had ordered a probe into Pizano's Nov. 9 death on fears of foul play after his son, Alejandro Pizano Ponce de Leon, died from cyanide poisoning two days later. The attorney general said the younger Pizano drank from a bottle of water on his father's desk and was dead within minutes. The son had arrived the ...

item.title: 'Petrified' witness tells inquest person of interest confessed to killing teen Annette Mason - ABC News
item.description:
'Petrified' witness tells inquest person of interest confessed to killing teen Annette Mason  ABC News

By Melinda Howells A key witness has changed her evidence at the inquest into the 1989 death of Queensland teenager Annette Mason, saying she heard a man confess to killing the 15-year-old. Witness Kylie Nothdurft told the Coroner's Court she was at a barbeque with Allan MacQueen the year after 15-year-old Annette Mason was killed, where she heard him say he had killed the teenager. Ms Nothdurft told police at the time about what she had heard, but said she "froze" when an initial inquest was held in 1991, because Mr MacQueen was in the court room, and she was "absolutely petrified" of him....

item.title: Army admits death of soldier during live-fire exercise was preventable - ABC News
item.description:
Army admits death of soldier during live-fire exercise was preventable  ABC News

By Felicity James The death of a Victorian soldier during a live-fire training exercise in the Northern Territory was preventable and followed a "monumental" failure in training, an inquest has heard. The inquest heard on Tuesday that the Geelong man had been in the Defence Force for 10 months and although he had "field firing" experience, the exercise was his first live-fire urban attack scenario. Counsel assisting the coroner Kelvin Currie told the inquest the Army's training systems appeared to have "monumentally failed" Private Challis. "The level of training of Private Challis and othe...

item.title: Death toll from Camp Fire rises to 76 as searchers find five more remains - CNN
item.description:
Death toll from Camp Fire rises to 76 as searchers find five more remains  CNN

The task is painstaking and painful. A searcher is given the name of someone who is unaccounted for and an address. A team heads over to the property, more than likely one where every evidence of life has been wiped out by flames. Many of the searchers are local and have lost their own homes. Now they look to see whether they can find the remains of their neighbors. Five more sets of remains were found Saturday, Butte County Sheriff and Coroner Kory Honea said. There are now at least 76 dead from the Camp Fire, which has obliterated more structures and lives than any previous fire in Califo...

item.title: Families of men killed in Birmingham wall collapse reject inquest verdict - The Guardian
item.description:
Families of men killed in Birmingham wall collapse reject inquest verdict  The Guardian

The families of five men killed when a wall collapsed at a scrap metal plant in Birmingham have condemned an inquest ruling of accidental death, saying the company’s management should face criminal prosecution. Almamo Jammeh, 45, Ousmane Diaby, 39, Bangally Dukureh, 55, Saibo Sillah, 42, and Muhamadou Jagana, 49, were killed in July 2016 when a 15ft (4.6-metre) wall made of interlocking concrete blocks collapsed as they were clearing out a storage bay at the Hawkeswood Metal Recycling site. An inquest at Birmingham coroner’s court heard the men had to be identified by their fingerprints aft...

item.title: Camp Fire death toll rises to 63 while missing list grows to 631 names - CNN
item.description:
Camp Fire death toll rises to 63 while missing list grows to 631 names  CNN

The number of missing in Californian wildfires has soared to 631, as authorities added hundreds of names to the lists of the unaccounted for Thursday, in what has become the deadliest and most destructive wildfire in the state's history. Butte County Sheriff and Coroner Kory Honea said Thursday evening the death toll from the Camp Fire in northern California had grown to 63 people. Seven sets of remains were discovered Thursday, he said. At least two other people have been killed in another, separate wildfire in Southern California, putting the state's death toll at 65 since the two blazes ...

item.title: Recycling plant deaths inquest: operations manager 'stunned and perplexed' - The Guardian
item.description:
Recycling plant deaths inquest: operations manager 'stunned and perplexed'  The Guardian

The operations manager of a metal recycling plant where five men were crushed to death by a collapsed wall has said he is “stunned and perplexed” by how the accident could have happened. Almamo Jammeh, 45, Ousmane Diaby, 39, Bangally Dukureh, 55, Saibo Sillah, 42, and Muhamadou Jagana, 49, were killed when a 15ft (4.6-metre) wall made of interlocking concrete blocks collapsed as they were clearing out a storage bay at the Hawkeswood Metal Recycling site in Birmingham in July 2016. An inquest at Birmingham coroner’s court previously heard how the men had to be identified by fingerprints afte...

item.title: Leicester City helicopter crash victims had 'minimal opportunity' to escape, inquest hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
Leicester City helicopter crash victims had 'minimal opportunity' to escape, inquest hears  The Telegraph

Leicester City owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha had "minimal opportunity" to escape from his helicopter when it crashed just yards from the club's stadium, an inquest has heard. The Thai billionaire and four other people died when the aircraft spun out of control and burst into flames on October 27. Leicester Coroner's Court was told that all five victims had been scientifically identified and were seen on CCTV in the tunnel at the King Power Stadium shortly before the helicopter took off. A police officer who gave evidence at the inquest said there was minimal opportunity for anybody else to...

item.title: Autopsy finds rapper Mac Miller died from drugs and alcohol - The Associated Press
item.description:
Autopsy finds rapper Mac Miller died from drugs and alcohol  The Associated Press

LOS ANGELES (AP) — Rapper Mac Miller died from an accidental overdose caused by a combination of cocaine, alcohol, and the powerful opioid fentanyl, a coroner's report released Monday said. The Los Angeles County coroner's report named Miller's cause of death as "mixed toxicity" of the three substances found in his system. The 26-year-old Pittsburgh native, who frankly discussed his depression and addiction in his rhymes, died suddenly on Sept. 7. He was known to many as Ariana Grande's ex-boyfriend, but had a devoted following that included some of the biggest names in hip-hop. Miller's pe...

item.title: Lack of warning signs where girl, nine, was crushed to death by falling rocks, inquest hears - The Telegraph
item.description:
Lack of warning signs where girl, nine, was crushed to death by falling rocks, inquest hears  The Telegraph

A schoolgirl was crushed to death by falling rocks on a British beach, a coroner ruled yesterday as he criticised a lack of signs warning of the danger. Michael Oakley called for "better signage" along a coastline that has witnessed 55,000 rock falls in just two years, as he delivered findings on the death of nine-year-old Harriet Forster. The schoolgirl was "in the wrong place at the wrong time" when a large boulder crumbled from a 200ft cliff on a beach in Staithes, N Yorks, in August this year, the inquest heard. She suffered devastating head and abdominal injuries from the impact and wa...

item.title: Leicester City crash victims 'had minimal opportunity to escape' - The Guardian
item.description:
Leicester City crash victims 'had minimal opportunity to escape'  The Guardian

The Leicester City owner, Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha, had minimal opportunity to escape from his helicopter when it crashed yards from the club’s stadium, an inquest has heard. Related: Kasper Schmeichel: Cardiff match was ‘like a cup final’ for Leicester The Thai billionaire and four other people died when the aircraft spun out of control and burst into flames on 27 October. Leicester coroner’s court was told all five victims had been identified and were seen on CCTV in the tunnel at King Power stadium shortly before the helicopter took off. A police officer who gave evidence at the inquest ...

item.title: Rapper Mac Miller died of drugs and alcohol overdose, coroner rules - The Guardian
item.description:
Rapper Mac Miller died of drugs and alcohol overdose, coroner rules  The Guardian

A coroner has ruled rapper Mac Miller’s death an accidental overdose due to a combination of drugs and alcohol. Related: Mac Miller: grizzled determination made troubled star a rap icon A Los Angeles county coroner’s report released on Monday named the 26-year-old Miller’s cause of death as “mixed toxicity”, saying cocaine, alcohol and the powerful opioid fentanyl were found in his system. Paramedics found Miller unresponsive in his Los Angeles home on 7 September and declared him dead soon after. An autopsy was performed on 10 September. The Pittsburgh native was in a two-year relationship...

item.title: NYPD: Saudi Sisters Found Dead Near Hudson River Likely Killed Themselves Rather Than Return Home - The Daily Beast
item.description:
NYPD: Saudi Sisters Found Dead Near Hudson River Likely Killed Themselves Rather Than Return Home  The Daily Beast

The New York Police Department’s top investigator indicated Friday that two Saudi sisters found dead and bound together last week near the Hudson River killed themselves, with authorities waiting on lab results from the coroners’ office for an official cause death. Police have not completely rule out other possibilities about how Tala Farea, 16, and Rotana Farea, 22, died, but “everything that we have seen so far, there is nothing pointing to a crime,” said NYPD Chief of Detectives Dermot Shea, adding that police believe they were alive when they went into the water. The sisters had reporte...

item.title: Family of teen who died by suicide want doctors investigated for possible disciplinary action - ABC News
item.description:
Family of teen who died by suicide want doctors investigated for possible disciplinary action  ABC News

By Felicity James The family of a teenager who took her own life wants the GPs responsible for her treatment investigated for possible disciplinary action, an inquest has been told. Sabrina Di Lembo, 19, died by suicide in August 2017 after her mental health spiralled, beginning with anxiety and panic attacks ahead of university law exams. On the final day of an inquest into Sabrina's death, the Di Lembo family's lawyer told Northern Territory coroner Greg Cavanagh the GPs who treated Sabrina were "incompetent". "Not only did the system let Sabrina down, it was worse than anyone could have ...

item.title: Sajid Javid's brother killed himself because he felt he would not 'last long' due to stomach problems, inquest told - The Telegraph
item.description:
Sajid Javid's brother killed himself because he felt he would not 'last long' due to stomach problems, inquest told  The Telegraph

Home Secretary Sajid Javid's eldest brother killed himself because he felt he would "not last long" due to his stomach problems, an inquest heard. Tariq Javid was more than five times the drink-drive limit when he collapsed in the shower at a country house hotel and drowned, as West Sussex senior coroner Penelope Schofield recorded a verdict of suicide. The court heard supermarket chain boss Mr Javid, 51, left his home in Horsham while his partner of 15 years Sylvia was out shopping on July 29 this year. Crawley Coroner's Court was told he left two identical letters that said he would "not ...

item.title: Mother still awaiting answers four years after daughter's death during childbirth - ABC News
item.description:
Mother still awaiting answers four years after daughter's death during childbirth  ABC News

By Andy Burns and Lauren Day Four years after 18-year-old Sommer Warren died giving birth, her mother Leisa Scammell is still waiting for answers about what went wrong. Chaos in the Victorian Coroners Court has meant the coronial investigation has only just been reassigned to a new coroner, days after 7.30 inquired about the matter. Ms Scammell has just marked four years since her daughter's death and grandson's birth. "It's bittersweet. You have to be joyful because it's a celebration of his birthday but also, she died bringing him into the world," she told 7.30. "It shouldn't happen in th...

item.title: Newcastle student died after initiation bar crawl, inquest told - The Guardian
item.description:
Newcastle student died after initiation bar crawl, inquest told  The Guardian

A university student died after an initiation ceremony bar crawl at which students ordered rounds of about 100 drinks at a time, an inquest has heard. Ed Farmer, 20, died in December 2016 after a Newcastle University agricultural society night out, a coroner was told on Monday. According to reports, medics said he had suffered a cardiorespiratory arrest and the alcohol level in his system was found to have been many times greater than the legal drink-driving limit. Farmer and his fellow students went out drinking in Newcastle on 12 December, the city’s coroner’s court heard. The first-year ...

item.title: Threats made against Manchester attack relatives, coroner told - The Guardian
item.description:
Threats made against Manchester attack relatives, coroner told  The Guardian

Relatives of those killed in the Manchester Arena bombing have been “very anxious” about attending the inquests after receiving threats, a court has heard. They were reassured that security at the inquests was being taken very seriously “at the highest level”. Police were stationed outside Manchester town hall on Thursday for a pre-inquest hearing into the deaths of the 22 people killed in the attack on an Ariana Grande concert on 22 May last year. The names of the dead were read out and a minute’s silence was held at the start of the proceedings. Many family members were present. The inque...

item.title: Met chief defends deputy who locked himself in car during terrorist rampage - The Telegraph
item.description:
Met chief defends deputy who locked himself in car during terrorist rampage  The Telegraph

Cressida Dick, the Metropolitan Police commissioner, has defended the actions of Sir Craig Mackey, her deputy, during the Westminster terror attack, insisting criticism of his failure to act was “ignorant” and “wrong”. Sir Craig faced accusations of cowardice and even calls for his knighthood to be stripped after he told an inquest that he locked himself in his car during Khalid Masood’s murderous rampage last year. But Mark Lucraft QC, the chief coroner, said Sir Craig’s actions were “sensible and proper” and he could have done nothing to prevent the tragedy. Masood killed four pedestrians...

item.title: Westminster attacker lawfully killed by minister's bodyguard, jury finds - The Guardian
item.description:
Westminster attacker lawfully killed by minister's bodyguard, jury finds  The Guardian

A minister’s bodyguard lawfully killed Khalid Masood as the Westminster Bridge attacker charged towards him after his murderous rampage, a jury has concluded. Masood, 52, from Kent, killed five people on 22 March last year in an attack lasting 82 seconds, before being shot dead by a close protection officer identified only as SA74. He drove his car into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge, killing Kurt Cochran, 54, Leslie Rhodes, 75, Aysha Frade, 44, and Andreea Cristea, 31, and seriously injuring 29 others. He then crashed his hired vehicle into a barrier at the Palace of Westminster, jumped...

item.title: Westminster terror attacker Khalid Masood was lawfully killed, inquest concludes - The Independent
item.description:
Westminster terror attacker Khalid Masood was lawfully killed, inquest concludes  The Independent

A minister’s bodyguard “lawfully killed” the Westminster attacker as he tried to find more victims, an inquest has found. A jury said Khalid Masood was moving towards close protection officers “at speed with knives still in hand” when one of them opened fire. The 52-year-old terrorist had already killed four victims with his car on Westminster Bridge, before stabbing PC Keith Palmer to death outside the Houses of Parliament. Read more - Police chief who locked himself in car during attack 'acted properly' - Minister's bodyguard tells of moment he shot Westminster attacker dead - ‘Nobody on ...

item.title: Dangerous trees earmarked for removal years before man crushed to death in ute - ABC News
item.description:
Dangerous trees earmarked for removal years before man crushed to death in ute  ABC News

By Annah Fromberg Trees in the area where a Tasmanian man was crushed and killed in wild weather in 2014 had been found to be in a dangerous condition and recommended for removal before the accident, a coroner has heard. An inquest has begun in Hobart into the death of 43-year-old father of two Brendan Mark Smith. Mr Smith was driving on the Channel Highway near Margate in February 2014 when a large eucalyptus tree fell on the roof of his ute, crushing him to death. Coroner Olivia McTaggart has heard the trees in the area had an extensive history dating back 20 years, with some planted by M...

item.title: Met Police chief who locked himself in car during Westminster attack acted 'properly', coroner says - The Independent
item.description:
Met Police chief who locked himself in car during Westminster attack acted 'properly', coroner says  The Independent

The actions of a police chief who locked himself in a car during the Westminster attack were “sensible and proper”, a coroner has said. Mark Lucraft QC, the chief coroner of England and Wales, said Khalid Masood had “already stabbed PC Keith Palmer” by the time Sir Craig Mackey saw him. “There was clearly nothing which Sir Craig could have done to stop Masood from attacking the officer,” he added. Read more - Minister's bodyguard tells of moment he shot Westminster attacker dead - Acting Met Police chief saw Westminster attack from inside locked car - ‘Nobody on trial’ at Westminster attack...

item.title: Pret has power to stop more food allergy deaths, says coroner - The Guardian
item.description:
Pret has power to stop more food allergy deaths, says coroner  The Guardian

Pret a Manger has the power to take action to prevent future deaths, a coroner at the inquest into the death of teenager Natasha Ednan-Laperouse has concluded. Ednan-Laperouse, then 15, died in July 2016 following a catastrophic allergic reaction after unknowingly eating sesame seeds contained in an artichoke, olive and tapenade baguette, which she had bought from a branch of Pret at Heathrow. The teenager was with her father when she collapsed on board a flight to Nice. Natasha’s father, Nadim Ednan-Laperouse, said she died because of “inadequate food labelling laws” and joined the rest of...

item.title: Dreamworld witnesses may be recalled as park owner accused of dragging its feet - ABC News
item.description:
Dreamworld witnesses may be recalled as park owner accused of dragging its feet  ABC News

Witnesses in the Dreamworld inquest may have to be recalled, with the theme park's owners criticised in court for taking too long to provide crucial documents. Dreamworld friday key points The inquiry into the deadly Dreamworld accident has been delayed because more than 1,000 new documents were only handed to the coroner this week. Cindy Low, Kate Goodchild, Luke Dorsett and Roozi Araghi were fatally crushed when the Thunder River Rapids ride malfunctioned in October 2016. Matthew Hickey, the barrister acting for Ms Low's family, said witnesses may have to be recalled, telling the court he...

item.title: Dreamworld inquest QC says lawyers planning to sue the park 'compromised' evidence - ABC News
item.description:
Dreamworld inquest QC says lawyers planning to sue the park 'compromised' evidence  ABC News

The counsel assisting the coroner at the inquest into the Dreamworld ride tragedy has slammed a legal firm for "compromising" evidence by publicly announcing three key witnesses were planning to sue the Gold Coast theme park. Key points: - Shine Lawyers announced outside inquest three witnesses would be suing Dreamworld - Ken Fleming QC says Shine's announcement was opportunistic and compromised inquest - Shine Lawyers stands by comments and rejects suggestion witnesses knew nothing of the move The inquest in the Southport Magistrates Court is investigating the deaths of four people who die...

item.title: Dreamworld inquest delayed to allow victims' lawyers time to review material - ABC News
item.description:
Dreamworld inquest delayed to allow victims' lawyers time to review material  ABC News

The inquest into the deadly Dreamworld accident has been delayed because more than 1,000 new documents have been handed to the coroner but have not been examined by lawyers for the victims' families. Cindy Low, Kate Goodchild, Luke Dorsett and Roozi Araghi were fatally crushed when the Thunder River Rapids ride malfunctioned in October 2016. Two years later, Dreamworld's owner Ardent Leisure is still producing relevant documents to the coronial inquest. On Monday, they handed over more than 1,000 documents and counsel assisting the coroner, Ken Fleming, said his colleagues had been "despera...

item.title: Bereaved family say they need £50,000 to pay for legal representation at inquest - The Guardian
item.description:
Bereaved family say they need £50,000 to pay for legal representation at inquest  The Guardian

The parents of a vulnerable student who took her own life at a university where there has been a series of deaths have spoken of the difficulty of ensuring there is a fair and transparent investigation because they are struggling to match the legal firepower of other parties involved. Margaret and Robert Abrahart believe their daughter, Natasha, a physics student at the University of Bristol, did not get the wellbeing support she needed despite expressing her desperation and asking for help. They are fighting for an inquest to be held before a jury and want it to examine whether Natasha’s h...

item.title: Westminster attack: PC's family accuse Met of ‘closing ranks’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Westminster attack: PC's family accuse Met of ‘closing ranks’  The Guardian

The family of PC Keith Palmer, murdered during a terrorist rampage on parliament, accused senior Metropolitan police officers of “closing ranks” after a coroner ruled on Wednesday that his death may have been prevented had armed officers been closer. The ruling highlighting “shortcomings” in how armed officers were managed by their bosses was a victory for Palmer’s family, angered by details that emerged during the month-long inquest of how the officer had been left vulnerable. After the verdict, the Met dropped its claim that Palmer’s life could not have been saved had armed officers been ...

item.title: Westminster attacker’s inquest is not criminal trial, coroner tells jury - The Guardian
item.description:
Westminster attacker’s inquest is not criminal trial, coroner tells jury  The Guardian

The jury at the inquest into the death of Khalid Masood, who carried out the Westminster Bridge attack in which five victims died, have been told “nobody is on trial” and there is “no question of attributing blame”. The chief coroner, Mark Lucraft QC, opened the inquest into the death of Masood at the Old Bailey on Thursday. The inquest, which is expected to last about two weeks, will explore the events leading up to Masood’s death. It will hear evidence from anonymous close protection officers and from medical professionals who provided care to him. It will also look at Masood’s life to se...

item.title: Coroner condemns "distressing" pictures taken of Westminster Bridge terror victims - The Telegraph
item.description:
Coroner condemns "distressing" pictures taken of Westminster Bridge terror victims  The Telegraph

A coroner has condemned passers by who took pictures of the Westminster Bridge attack victims rather than helping them, as one victim has spoken out against social media trolls who accused him of being a “fake” actor. Chief coroner Mark Lucraft QC called for the "very distressing" pictures of the injured to be taken off the internet, which particularly affected the family of Aysha Frade, the inquest heard. Mother of two Mrs Frade was “killed instantaneously” after being struck from behind by Khalid Masood’s hired SUV vehicle on 22 March last year. She was one of four pedestrians killed in t...

item.title: Teacher was found dead after being told she was emotionally immature - The Telegraph
item.description:
Teacher was found dead after being told she was emotionally immature  The Telegraph

A perfectionist teacher was found dead after being told she was emotionally immature and unfit to return to work. Doncaster Coroner's Court heard Chelsey Peart, 27, who taught at Rawmarsh Community School and also ran a textiles business, was found by her husband Mark at their home in Rotherham in April. She had previously been signed off work by her GP on a number of occasions dating back to November 2017. Helen O'Brien, headteacher at the school, said she took Mrs Peart to the hospital in November last year, after she told another member of staff she had had suicidal thoughts on the journ...

item.title: Pc Keith Palmer's widow says husband was 'left to die' by Met Police as coroner rules death could have been prevented - The Telegraph
item.description:
Pc Keith Palmer's widow says husband was 'left to die' by Met Police as coroner rules death could have been prevented  The Telegraph

Pc Keith Palmer's widow has said her husband was "left to die" by the Met Police as a coroner in the Westminster terror attack inquest ruled his death could have been prevented had armed officers been there to defend him. Mark Lucraft QC concluded on Wednesday that all five victims of the were "unlawfully killed" by Khalid Masood and said it was "possible" Pc Palmer would not have died had the officers been in place. The widow of murdered Pc Palmer, Michelle Palmer, welcomed the coroner’s findings, and said: "How could Keith have been left alone, unarmed, guarding an open gate at one of th...

item.title: The Guardian view on the Westminster attack inquest: the police must change - The Guardian
item.description:
The Guardian view on the Westminster attack inquest: the police must change  The Guardian

We all make mistakes – as individuals and organisations. The important thing is to admit and learn from them. This matters most when the mistakes are serious ones. And that is why the failure of the Metropolitan police to acccept its share of responsibility for the death of one of its own officers in a terrorist attack last year, until it was forced to do so by a coroner, is so worrying. In a ruling delivered on Wednesday, Mark Lucraft found that PC Keith Palmer and the other four victims of last March’s attack in Westminster – Kurt Cochran, Leslie Rhodes, Aysha Frade and Andreea Cristea – ...

item.title: Westminster attack: PC Keith Palmer could have been saved if Met put armed police on Parliament gates, coroner finds - The Independent
item.description:
Westminster attack: PC Keith Palmer could have been saved if Met put armed police on Parliament gates, coroner finds  The Independent

“Shortcomings in security” outside the Houses of Parliament contributed to the death of a police officer during the Westminster attack, a coroner has concluded. Judge Mark Lucraft QC, the Chief Coroner of England and Wales, said the Metropolitan Police had allowed the entrance PC Keith Palmer was guarding to be neglected by “roving” armed officers. Delivering his conclusions at the Old Bailey, he said the two armed officers assigned to the area had not been near Carriage Gates for almost an hour before Khalid Masood struck because they were unaware of official guidance. Read more - Coroner ...

item.title: UK coroner cites security shortcomings in officer's death - The Associated Press
item.description:
UK coroner cites security shortcomings in officer's death  The Associated Press

LONDON (AP) — Security failures may have played a role in the stabbing death of a policeman during an extremist attack on Parliament last year in London, Britain's chief coroner said Wednesday. Coroner Mark Lucraft said "shortcomings in the security system" meant armed officers weren't guarding an entrance to Parliament when an extremist stabbed policeman Keith Palmer to death on March 22, 2017. Palmer was one of five people killed by 52-year-old Khalid Masood in the attack on Westminster Bridge and Parliament. Masood was then shot dead by police. Speaking at an inquest, Lucraft said armed ...

item.title: ‘Nobody on trial’ at Westminster attacker’s inquest, says coroner - The Independent
item.description:
‘Nobody on trial’ at Westminster attacker’s inquest, says coroner  The Independent

Jurors have been warned not to “jump to conclusions” or attach blame as the inquest into the death of Westminster attacker Khalid Masood gets under way. Mark Lucraft QC told the group they would be required to come to conclusions about the identity of the deceased, when, where and how he died. But he stressed that the jurors could not “express an opinion on other matters”. “Nobody is on trial here – an inquest does not decide matters of criminal liability. There is no question of attributing blame,” the chief coroner said. “Please keep an open mind. Do not jump to conclusions.” - Read more ...

item.title: Coroner calls for food label reform as video shows girl's final moments before fatal allergic reaction to Pret a Manger baguette - The Telegraph
item.description:
Coroner calls for food label reform as video shows girl's final moments before fatal allergic reaction to Pret a Manger baguette  The Telegraph

The coroner of an inquest into the death of a teenage girl killed by an allergy has called on the Government to examine labelling rules, after he found Pret a Manger signs were inadequate. Natasha Ednan-Laperouse was 15 when she collapsed on a British Airways flight from London to Nice on July 17, 2016 after eating a baguette, which contained sesame seeds, bought from the Heathrow airport branch of Pret a Manger. Its packaging bore no allergen advice, which was not required by law because the food was made on-site at the branch and there were general notices posted around the shop. The coro...

item.title: Westminster attack inquests - latest updates: Coroner gives conclusions on how victims of terror attacker Khalid Masood died - The Independent
item.description:
Westminster attack inquests - latest updates: Coroner gives conclusions on how victims of terror attacker Khalid Masood died  The Independent

The inquests into the deaths of the victims of the Westminster attack are due to conclude. Chief coroner Mark Lucraft QC is due to give his conclusions at the Old Bailey on the deaths of four civilians and police officer Keith Palmer, who were murdered by terrorist Khalid Masood. He will consider whether factors including security at the Houses of Parliament, the lack of barriers on Westminster Bridge, police body armour and security service investigations into Masood played a role in their deaths. Please allow a moment for the live blog to load. On Tuesday the court heard closing submissio...

item.title: 'Brutally ripped away from us': Remembering the five victims who died in Westminster terror attack - The Independent
item.description:
'Brutally ripped away from us': Remembering the five victims who died in Westminster terror attack  The Independent

The tourists, politicians and Londoners swirling around Westminster on 22 March 2017 were going about their lives “as if it was any other day” until a terrorist launched the first Isis-claimed attack in Britain. Judge Mark Lucraft QC, the chief coroner of England and Wales, said: “They all there to enjoy the day. For many, it would have been their first time of seeing those sights; for others a return visit, and perhaps sharing their favourite views with friends. Others were in the area for work, or for business.” Khalid Masood struck the heart of Britain and a global symbol of democracy in...

item.title: Pret allergy inquest: coroner questions BA cabin crew's training - The Guardian
item.description:
Pret allergy inquest: coroner questions BA cabin crew's training  The Guardian

British Airways’ safety training for cabin crew has been called into question at the inquest into the death of a teenager with food allergies who collapsed on one of the airline’s flights. Natasha Ednan-Laperouse, 15, from Fulham, south-west London, was on flight BA342 from London to Nice on 17 July 2016 when she fell ill after eating a baguette she had bought from a branch of Pret A Manger at Heathrow airport’s Terminal 5. She died later that day in hospital. The inquest, at west London coroner’s court, has heard that BA staff did not fetch an onboard defibrillator nor tell a doctor treati...

item.title: Pret a Manger allergy death: Coroner says labelling failed to warn teenager about allergen that killed her - The Independent
item.description:
Pret a Manger allergy death: Coroner says labelling failed to warn teenager about allergen that killed her  The Independent

Pret a Manger's food labelling failed to warn a 15-year-old girl who died after eating one of its baguettes that the sandwich contained allergens, an inquest has heard. Concluding the hearing into the death of Natasha Ednan-Laperouse, coroner Dr Sean Cummings recorded a narrative verdict, finding that the teenager was "reassured" by the lack of specific warnings on the packaging. "Natasha Ednan-Laperouse died of anaphylaxis in Nice on July 17, 2016, after eating a baguette purchased from Pret a Manger at London Heathrow's Terminal 5," he said. "The baguette was manufactured to Pret specific...

item.title: Pret a Manger to label food after schoolgirl's death - CNN
item.description:
Pret a Manger to label food after schoolgirl's death  CNN

Pret a Manger will list all its ingredients, including allergens, on freshly made products following the death of a 15-year-old girl who had an allergic reaction to a sandwich containing sesame seeds, to which she was allergic. Natasha Ednan-Laperouse fell ill on a British Airways flight to Nice, France after buying an olive tapenade and artichoke baguette from a branch of Pret a Manger at London Heathrow Airport. She died later of anaphylactic shock, a UK medical coroner ruled last week. Pret a Manger Chief Executive Clive Schlee said in a statement that the fast-food chain was "deeply sor...

item.title: Pret death: Father attacks chain saying daughter forced to 'play Russian roulette' with her life - The Independent
item.description:
Pret death: Father attacks chain saying daughter forced to 'play Russian roulette' with her life  The Independent

The father of a girl who died after suffering an allergic reaction to a Pret a Manger sandwich has accused the company and the government of playing “Russian roulette” with her life. Nadim Ednan-Laperouse said the death of his daughter Natasha, 15, should be a “watershed moment” that prompts life-saving changes in food labelling laws. The teenager, who was allergic to sesame, died after eating an artichoke, olive and tapenade baguette that did not list the ingredient on its packaging. - Read more Pret labelling ‘did not warn teenager about allergen that killed her’ She collapsed on a Britis...
